org.cougaar.core.service
Interface PersistenceControlService

All Superinterfaces:
Service
All Known Implementing Classes:
PersistenceServiceComponent.PersistenceControlServiceImpl
public interface PersistenceControlService
extends Service

This service can be used to view and modify persistence settings.

Method Summary
 java.lang.String[] getControlNames()
          Gets the names of all controls (operating modes).
 OMCRangeList getControlValues(java.lang.String controlName)
          Gets the (allowed) values of a given control.
 java.lang.String[] getMediaControlNames(java.lang.String mediaName)
          Gets the names of the controls for the named media (plugin).
 OMCRangeList getMediaControlValues(java.lang.String mediaName, java.lang.String controlName)
          Gets the allowed values of then named control for the named media plugin.
 java.lang.String[] getMediaNames()
          Gets the names of the installed media plugins.
 void setControlValue(java.lang.String controlName, java.lang.Comparable newValue)
          Sets the value for the named control.
 void setMediaControlValue(java.lang.String mediaName, java.lang.String controlName, java.lang.Comparable newValue)
          Sets the value for the named control for the named media plugin.
 

Method Detail

getControlNames

java.lang.String[] getControlNames()
Gets the names of all controls (operating modes). These are controls over persistence as a whole, not media-specific.

Returns:
an array of all control names

getControlValues

OMCRangeList getControlValues(java.lang.String controlName)
Gets the (allowed) values of a given control. Values used to set a control must be in the ranges specified by the return.

Parameters:
controlName - the name of a persistence-wide control
Returns:
a list of ranges of values that are allowed for the named control.

setControlValue

void setControlValue(java.lang.String controlName,
                     java.lang.Comparable newValue)
Sets the value for the named control. The value must be in the list or ranges returned by getControlValues(java.lang.String).

Parameters:
controlName - the name of the control to set.
newValue - the new value for the control. Must be in the allowed ranges.

getMediaNames

java.lang.String[] getMediaNames()
Gets the names of the installed media plugins.

Returns:
an array of the names of the installed media plugins.

getMediaControlNames

java.lang.String[] getMediaControlNames(java.lang.String mediaName)
Gets the names of the controls for the named media (plugin).

Parameters:
mediaName - the name of the media.
Returns:
an array of all control names for the given media.

getMediaControlValues

OMCRangeList getMediaControlValues(java.lang.String mediaName,
                                   java.lang.String controlName)
Gets the allowed values of then named control for the named media plugin. Values used to set a control must be in the ranges specified by the return.

Parameters:
mediaName - the name of the media having the control
controlName - the name of a media-specific control
Returns:
a list of ranges of values that are allowed for the named control.

setMediaControlValue

void setMediaControlValue(java.lang.String mediaName,
                          java.lang.String controlName,
                          java.lang.Comparable newValue)
Sets the value for the named control for the named media plugin. The value must be in the list or ranges returned by getMediaControlValues(java.lang.String, java.lang.String).

Parameters:
mediaName - the name of the media having the control
controlName - the name of the control to set.
newValue - the new value for the control. Must be in the allowed ranges.
